title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that fertilization joins gametes with different allele combinations of the genes for body color and wing shape.
The response indicates that fertilization joins gametes with different allele combinations of the genes for body color and wing shape.

title: Part B (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The sketched bars meet none of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet one of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet two of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet all of the criteria below.

title: Part B (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that based on error bars, the number of flies with the phenotype ebony body and long wings is the same as the number of flies with the phenotype gray body and vestigial wings. The response also does not indicate that based on the error bars, the numbers of flies with the two other phenotypes are significantly different from each other and from those of the first two phenotypes.

The response indicates that based on error bars, the number of flies with the phenotype ebony body and long wings is the same as the number of flies with the phenotype gray body and vestigial wings. Based on the error bars, the numbers of flies with the two other phenotypes are significantly different from each other and from those of the first two phenotypes.

title: Part C (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the ratio of phenotypes is 9:3:3:1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI5aGaaiOoai aaiodacaGG6aGaaG4maiaacQdacaaIXaaaaa@3E30@ , which is characteristic of a dihybrid cross with two genes that are on separate chromosomes.

title: Part C (iii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the probability is 0.5. The response incorrectly calculates the probability of having gray bodies or of having vestigial wings or incorrectly combines the two probabilities. The probability of flies having gray bodies is 1.0, because the gray color is dominant and one of the flies in the cross is homozygous for a gray body. The probability of flies having vestigial wings is 0.5, because vestigial wings are recessive and one of the flies is homozygous for vestigial wings, while the F 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGgbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaigdaaeqaaaaa@3AAE@ fly is heterozygous for this trait. The probability of flies having the two traits is calculated by multiplying the two individual probabilities together: 1×0.5=0.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaey41aq RaaGimaiaac6cacaaI1aGaeyypa0JaaGimaiaac6cacaaI1aaaaa@412C@ .

The response indicates that the probability is 0.5. The probability of flies having gray bodies is 1.0, because the gray color is dominant and one of the flies in the cross is homozygous for a gray body. The probability of flies having vestigial wings is 0.5, because vestigial wings are recessive and one of the flies is homozygous for vestigial wings, while the F 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGgbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaigdaaeqaaaaa@3AAE@ fly is heterozygous for this trait. title: Part D (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that in the second analysis the genes for gray or ebony body color and long or curly wings are linked on the same chromosome.
The response indicates that in the second analysis the genes for gray or ebony body color and long or curly wings are linked on the same chromosome.
